Text: WR Pitch System performance Cc LNotesnsf Tom Here is the report I prepared on the methods and types of grpahs for this work request As examples I used the May graphs including the Paretos for the Pitch and overspeed faults If you need additional clarification or have questions let me know Mark

Curtaildb Question Cc LNotesnsf Joe Attached is the Curtaildb file I have a question about a sequence of events For turbine on June th the turbine is Energy curtailed Index THEN it has the message Turbine Com Established Index Then there are no other messages for that turbine until a Energy curtailed message Index Is there anything I can assume about the time between the curtailment messages For example was the turbine uncurtailed when the com established message was recorded Or are did the turbine become uncurtailed and no message was recorded Thanks Mark

Subset of data with extreme temp Cc LNotesnsf Andre Here is a short subset of minute records containing the extreme temperature event approximately hours of beforeafter data The turbine was at Desert Sky on May st Times are in UTC The values are minute averages If you have additional questions let me know Mark

Gearbox Temp graphs Cc LNotesnsf Tom The graphs attached are formatted the same as the sample set I sent you earlier As of today Desert Sky minute data has not been uploaded for June yet and the data for Jan is nonexistant so the graphs go from Feb to May If you have questions or comments let me know Mark

Gear Box Temp Graphs Cc LNotesnsf Tom Here is a sample of the output for this request For this I have only used May I for the boxplots one has had records removed when the ambient and gearbox temp is less than I can provide turbines and times if needed There were many records where this occured There were also records where the Gearbox temp was over and these were also removed All of these over records occured on turbine on May st between and UTC Temperatures were as high as If this format is acceptable let me know and I will generate graphs for the data we have Jan current Mark
ROI LNotesnsf I think I have the formulas fixed in this one

Re Do Not Download or Install Software to your Machines Cc LNotesnsf Denise A couple of questions about software I have used and would like to continue to use MiKTeX A windows version of TeX the technical typesetting program I find it is useful for automatically formatting reports in fact I have designed the automated summary report for the turbine SPC report using this program This is freeware The TeX users group has information of TeX implementations MiKTeX is probably the best but PCTeX by Personal TeX is a good nonfree version Please let me know what will need to be done so that I can continue to use this software I was also planning to start Syncing my PDA with Outlook as soon as Outlook is configured for use So can I install the Palm software for this purpose Mark Fisher Denise Williams AM To GEBenefits cc Subject Do Not Download or Install Software to your Machines In accordance with the GE Power Systems Information Security Manual and Security Procedure Guide a copy can be found on the Transfer directory under GEPS Information Security Manual users are not allowed to download or install software that is not authorized by GEPS management This includes but is not limited to Web Shots Real Player Spinner WinAmp Games Post It Notes Bonzi Buddy Napster Morpheus or Limewire Additionally users are not allowed to bring in software from home and install it on their work computers Please take a little time and read through the Guide GE has strict policies and procedures regarding the use of GE owned equipment and they monitor every machine on the network If you have any questions about what can or can not be loaded on your machine please send me an email Thanks D

WR Pitch System Performance Energy Cc LNotesnsf Tom I have energy estimates for May attached Graph is site totals graph is total losttotal actual production where total actual production is taken from the kWh reported in the owner report and graph is the by turbine distribution using box plots of energy lost The energy lost estimation method I employed is susceptible to problems with data recovery minute data which in May was especially poor at Klondike and Fenner so those number are not as informative as those for the other sites If these graphs provide you the information you need I will continue with the remaining months Jan Apr Otherwise let me know and well refine this process to get you what you need Mark

data Cc LNotesnsf Forwarded by Mark FisherEWCEnron on AM Nagwa Elkachouty PM To Mark nron cc Subject data hello Mark I need to get the following information for the kw turbines may be from storm lake lake benton We need these infos ASAP Please help currents all phase if possible generator voltages all phases if possible generator generator RPM KW generator temperature generator rotor current voltage frequency any information the system is recording for the rotor I would like to get it Can we collect the above information over all the speed range of the generator since the turbine starts till maximum speed hypersynchronousabove synchoronus Thanks very much Nagwa

WR Pitch System Fault Pareto Cc LNotesnsf Tom From the stage I was at on the duration and energy it was just as easy to do all sites as the you specifically requested If you do not want the additional graphs let me know and Ill pull them out of the Acrobat file Mark

May curtailment spread LNotesnsf Jeff The files are in DesertSkyCurtail in your transfer dirtectory Check the sums of the KWHLOST columns with the values you were provided These all seem to have been created the same day Mark

WR Fault Paretos May Cc LNotesnsf Tom Here are the fault paretos of fault counts for all sites for May mayparetosfaultspdf For readability only the top faults for each site are displayed Both Texas sites had VERY high numbers of wind deviation faults I am also attaching a file from a different work request that has a pareto by site of the mean number of faults per turbine maymeanfaultspdf which shows that the Texas sites have the highest mean faults per turbine This also has boxplots of the number of faults by site to show the outliers I will do the June data if still desired when the data upload is completed As always if you have questions or comments let me know Mark

WR Pitch System Performance Cc LNotesnsf Tom Here are the new graphs with totals bar charts and distributions boxplots for all seven sites through May I believe that I have come up with a method of providing you with the ESTIMATED energy lost Since it requires using two data sets faults and minute data it will be take a bit longer to run However I hope to have that result to you next week Mark

WR Pitch System Performance Cc LNotesnsf Tom Maybe I misinterpreted again but here are the graphs for site total the boxplots are still by turbine This is for May I will wait to see if this is more like what you need before continuing with the earlier months Mark

Re Tehachapi Only Desktop and Dell laptop Users LNotesnsf They are both doomat Denise Williams PM To GEBenefits cc Subject Tehachapi Only Desktop and Dell laptop Users We will be working this weekend to coreload as many machines as we possibly can Please send me your network and lotus notes password If we do not have your passwords I will reset them to password We will start with the South facility and if all goes well proceed to the north Please leave your machine logged on NOTE If you are an Expedition user we can not load your machine yet as the current version of Expedition does not run properly on Windows A new version of Expedition will be installed on July D

Distribution Disclaimer LNotesnsf Forwarded by Mark FisherEWCEnron on AM Hollis Kimbrough PM To Mark nron cc Subject Distribution Disclaimer Mark Since we have not heard back from legal lets use this phrase The data on this disk is intended for the exclusive use of NREL and is not intended for further distribution HK

Desert Sky Curtailment LNotesnsf Jeff Mar May have been recalculated and spreadsheets created Mar Apr wend down slightly due to the extra turbines May has gone up possibly due to some data filling in holes from before data recovery does appear to be better this time The spreadsheets are sorted and totaled by BusID The extras are at the bottom with production Mark
Fluvanna and Trew Ranch reports Cc LNotesnsf Tim In Oct I produced the attached reports for Michael Paine I hope these are helpful Mark
Work Request LNotesnsf Fault Pareto Work Request From Tom Nemila
Work Req Cc LNotesnsf Forwarded by Mark FisherEWCEnron on AM Tom Nemila PM To Mark nron cc Subject Work Req

Re Mill Run report through May with Virtual Mode corrections Cc LNotesnsf On a per turbine basis he would be expecting some to have big drops However for the entire site the amount we were talking about would be about for month Though I dont know if he expected individual turbines to have more impact on the site average than they do For turbines having one drop only lowers the site by Kurt Anderson PM To Jeff NRON Mark V NRON Mark nron cc Subject Mill Run report through May with Virtual Mode corrections If we are only talking about a drop in avg availability we had better be ready to defend our numbers Not just defend but convince Zilkha why we are right with our calcs Mark F unless I am mistaken Gary V is expecting a bigger drop Forwarded by Kurt AndersonEWCEnron on PM Mark V Walker PM To Kurt NRON cc Hollis NRON Subject Mill Run report through May with Virtual Mode corrections Summary The Jan May availabilities are revised to exclude virtual mode pause events The results showed that every turbine had between one and two hours each month where the WTG was transitioning between states as per design Therefore the resulting total hours of pausing and virtual mode for each turbine was decreased by one and a half hours In addition the pausing due to noise curtailment at turbine between the hours of PM and AM local time was excluded No other changes were made to the SCADA data The net result is that the Jan availability dropped by Feb dropped by Mar dropped by Apr dropped by Dec data was not corrected due becasue the data recovery of the minana files in that month was very poor The Somerset report is well underway and will be in a similar form

Re Curtaildb Question LNotesnsf Forwarded by Mark FisherEWCEnron on AM Joe Chapman AM To Mark nron cc Subject Re Curtaildb Question Hi Mark The message at says the the computer was rebooted at that time That is about the only way that I know of that this message would be recorded When the TrbCurtail Service is started it does not remember what turbines were curtailed It waits minutes after starting before issuing any commands to calculate a minute average After the minute startup wait the first command output from this program would have released all turbines that were currently curtailed and curtailed new turbines as needed to keep the minute average MW output at the curtailment setpoint So at any turbines that were curtailed before that time would have been released The curtailment log file Visupro creates at the turbine should be able to verify this if needed Database System Index Number DateTime Msg Energy curtailed Turbine curtailed TrbCurtail Service Started Computer rebooted Turbine Com Established Com established to turbine Joe Mark Fisher PM To Joe NRON cc Jeff NRON Subject Curtaildb Question Joe Attached is the Curtaildb file I have a question about a sequence of events For turbine on June th the turbine is Energy curtailed Index THEN it has the message Turbine Com Established Index Then there are no other messages for that turbine until a Energy curtailed message Index Is there anything I can assume about the time between the curtailment messages For example was the turbine uncurtailed when the com established message was recorded Or are did the turbine become uncurtailed and no message was recorded Thanks Mark

WR Pitch System Performance Cc LNotesnsf Tom Attached are the graphs for energy lost due to the pitch and overspeed faults you listed As I mentioned before the methodology requires decent data recovery for the minute data The data recovery was poor for several sites in January and for Fenner and Klondike in May I will be compiling a report on this request summarizing the graph types and some explanation of the methods used to produce them I hope to have that completed within the next couple of days If you see deficiencies or suggested modifications let me know Mark

Distribution Disclaimer LNotesnsf Forwarded by Mark FisherEWCEnron on AM Hollis Kimbrough PM To Mark nron cc Subject Distribution Disclaimer Mark Since we have not heard back from legal lets use this phrase The data on this disk is intended for the exclusive use of NREL and is not intended for further distribution HK

Curtaildb Question Cc LNotesnsf Joe Attached is the Curtaildb file I have a question about a sequence of events For turbine on June th the turbine is Energy curtailed Index THEN it has the message Turbine Com Established Index Then there are no other messages for that turbine until a Energy curtailed message Index Is there anything I can assume about the time between the curtailment messages For example was the turbine uncurtailed when the com established message was recorded Or are did the turbine become uncurtailed and no message was recorded Thanks Mark

Re Curtaildb Question LNotesnsf Forwarded by Mark FisherEWCEnron on AM Joe Chapman AM To Mark nron cc Subject Re Curtaildb Question Hi Mark The message at says the the computer was rebooted at that time That is about the only way that I know of that this message would be recorded When the TrbCurtail Service is started it does not remember what turbines were curtailed It waits minutes after starting before issuing any commands to calculate a minute average After the minute startup wait the first command output from this program would have released all turbines that were currently curtailed and curtailed new turbines as needed to keep the minute average MW output at the curtailment setpoint So at any turbines that were curtailed before that time would have been released The curtailment log file Visupro creates at the turbine should be able to verify this if needed Database System Index Number DateTime Msg Energy curtailed Turbine curtailed TrbCurtail Service Started Computer rebooted Turbine Com Established Com established to turbine Joe Mark Fisher PM To Joe NRON cc Jeff NRON Subject Curtaildb Question Joe Attached is the Curtaildb file I have a question about a sequence of events For turbine on June th the turbine is Energy curtailed Index THEN it has the message Turbine Com Established Index Then there are no other messages for that turbine until a Energy curtailed message Index Is there anything I can assume about the time between the curtailment messages For example was the turbine uncurtailed when the com established message was recorded Or are did the turbine become uncurtailed and no message was recorded Thanks Mark

Re Mill Run report through May with Virtual Mode corrections Cc LNotesnsf On a per turbine basis he would be expecting some to have big drops However for the entire site the amount we were talking about would be about for month Though I dont know if he expected individual turbines to have more impact on the site average than they do For turbines having one drop only lowers the site by Kurt Anderson PM To Jeff NRON Mark V NRON Mark nron cc Subject Mill Run report through May with Virtual Mode corrections If we are only talking about a drop in avg availability we had better be ready to defend our numbers Not just defend but convince Zilkha why we are right with our calcs Mark F unless I am mistaken Gary V is expecting a bigger drop Forwarded by Kurt AndersonEWCEnron on PM Mark V Walker PM To Kurt NRON cc Hollis NRON Subject Mill Run report through May with Virtual Mode corrections Summary The Jan May availabilities are revised to exclude virtual mode pause events The results showed that every turbine had between one and two hours each month where the WTG was transitioning between states as per design Therefore the resulting total hours of pausing and virtual mode for each turbine was decreased by one and a half hours In addition the pausing due to noise curtailment at turbine between the hours of PM and AM local time was excluded No other changes were made to the SCADA data The net result is that the Jan availability dropped by Feb dropped by Mar dropped by Apr dropped by Dec data was not corrected due becasue the data recovery of the minana files in that month was very poor The Somerset report is well underway and will be in a similar form

Re Do Not Download or Install Software to your Machines Cc LNotesnsf Denise A couple of questions about software I have used and would like to continue to use MiKTeX A windows version of TeX the technical typesetting program I find it is useful for automatically formatting reports in fact I have designed the automated summary report for the turbine SPC report using this program This is freeware The TeX users group has information of TeX implementations MiKTeX is probably the best but PCTeX by Personal TeX is a good nonfree version Please let me know what will need to be done so that I can continue to use this software I was also planning to start Syncing my PDA with Outlook as soon as Outlook is configured for use So can I install the Palm software for this purpose Mark Fisher Denise Williams AM To GEBenefits cc Subject Do Not Download or Install Software to your Machines In accordance with the GE Power Systems Information Security Manual and Security Procedure Guide a copy can be found on the Transfer directory under GEPS Information Security Manual users are not allowed to download or install software that is not authorized by GEPS management This includes but is not limited to Web Shots Real Player Spinner WinAmp Games Post It Notes Bonzi Buddy Napster Morpheus or Limewire Additionally users are not allowed to bring in software from home and install it on their work computers Please take a little time and read through the Guide GE has strict policies and procedures regarding the use of GE owned equipment and they monitor every machine on the network If you have any questions about what can or can not be loaded on your machine please send me an email Thanks D
